page.title: 19FORESTRY IN BALLINDALLOCH
page.content: Some of the higher slopes of our area are used for forestry. Most of the trees grown are conifers,because of their faster growth.They are therefore called softwoods. However, some hardwoods are also grown,each tree to start with inside a plastic tube, which promotes growth rather as a greenhouse does. There are also some Research areas for forestry experiments. The foresters must protect the trees from diseases,from deer and rabbits which damage the young trees, and from fungi which may kill the trees. The lowest part of the tree is generally used for building materials, the next part for boxes and pallets, the next for chipboard, and the top section for paper.
